LandingPage.title: Understand Your Personality with the Big Five Model
LandingPage.explanation: The Big Five personality traits model is a widely accepted framework in psychology describing human personality through five broad dimensions: Openness, Conscientiousness, Extraversion, Agreeableness, and Neuroticism. Openness reflects a person's willingness to try new things and their level of imagination. Conscientiousness measures organization, dependability, and responsibility. Extraversion indicates how outgoing and sociable a person is. Agreeableness refers to traits like compassion, cooperativeness, and kindness. Neuroticism, also known as Emotional Stability, assesses how prone an individual is to experiencing negative emotions like anxiety or sadness. The Mini-IPIP is a short, 20-item questionnaire derived from the larger International Personality Item Pool. Despite its brevity, studies have shown the Mini-IPIP to be a reliable and valid instrument for quickly assessing these five core personality traits. It provides a scientifically-grounded snapshot of one's personality, offering valuable insights into personal tendencies and preferences. Its conciseness makes it accessible for a broad audience, balancing efficiency with reasonable accuracy for non-clinical, general understanding of personality.

InstructionsPage.title: Assessment Instructions
InstructionsPage.instructions: Please read each statement carefully and rate how accurately it describes you. There are no right or wrong answers. Be honest with yourself for the most accurate results.

ResultsPage.title: Your Mini-IPIP Personality Profile

openness.high: You are highly open to new experiences, imaginative, and intellectually curious. You likely enjoy variety and are creative.
openness.medium: You have a balanced approach to new experiences, being open to some novel ideas while also appreciating routine and the familiar.
openness.low: You tend to be more conventional, practical, and prefer familiar routines. You might be cautious about new or abstract ideas.

conscientiousness.high: You are very organized, dependable, and self-disciplined. You likely plan ahead and are persistent in achieving your goals.
conscientiousness.medium: You are generally reliable and organized, but can also be flexible and spontaneous when needed.
conscientiousness.low: You tend to be more spontaneous, flexible, and perhaps less organized. You might prefer a less structured approach to tasks.

extraversion.high: You are outgoing, energetic, and sociable. You likely enjoy being around others and are often assertive and talkative.
extraversion.medium: You are comfortable in social situations but also value your alone time. You can be outgoing or reserved depending on the context.
extraversion.low: You are more introverted, reserved, and prefer quieter settings. You might find large social gatherings draining and prefer solitary activities.

agreeableness.high: You are compassionate, cooperative, and kind. You likely value harmony in relationships and are considerate of others' feelings.
agreeableness.medium: You are generally cooperative and considerate, but can also assert your own needs and opinions when necessary.
agreeableness.low: You tend to be more analytical, competitive, and may prioritize your own interests. You might be more skeptical or challenging in your interactions.

neuroticism.high: You may experience emotions like anxiety, sadness, or irritability more frequently and intensely. You might be more sensitive to stress.
neuroticism.medium: You experience a typical range of emotions and can manage stress reasonably well. You may have occasional mood swings but generally maintain emotional balance.
neuroticism.low: You are generally calm, emotionally stable, and resilient. You likely handle stress well and experience negative emotions less frequently.
